question:
The CBDT has instituted a grievance redressal cell for startups. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. The cell will deal with issues related to angel tax.
  2. The cell will deal with issues with respect to administration of Income Tax Act.
  3. Startups in India enjoy a 3 year tax holiday.
Which of the above statements are true?
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: The Central Board of Direct Taxes has setup a startup cell for grievance redressal. It is composed of 5 members. It will address issues in relation to the angel tax. Recently startups have been exempt from angel tax which is imposed on angel investors. It is a tax imposed on a private firm when the funds raised by it is above its fair valuation. Statement 2 is correct: The startup cell will deal with issues in relation to the administration of Income Tax Act, 1961. Recently the inapplicability of section 56(2)(viib) of Income Tax Act to startups was declared by the finance ministry. The section was introduced into the act to curb use of unaccounted money. Statement 3 is correct: Startups in India enjoy a 3 years tax holiday in a 7 years block. An eligible startup does not have to pay tax on profits for 3 years if its turnover doesnâ€™t exceed 25 crore INR per year. This is to aid the startups to establish itself during the initial stages when capital scarcity is a common problem.
